title: How to write an introduction - Quora

response.answer_text: Introduction to what? Novel? Essay? Short Story? If it’s an essay you’ll need to introduce the topic. What are you talking about? Is it an analysis of a work of literature? Introduce the work. In “Name of Work”, by [name of author], something happens with the characters….. That’s usually how I start my essays, sometimes with some kind of hook leading into the introduction of the work. For example, when discussing Henrik Ibsen’s “A Doll House”, a play where Nora leaves her husband I started with. The desire for freedom can be strong enough to make some abandon their safety net. In “A Doll House” …… The first sentence needs to relate to the topic you’re discussing though, and can be tricky.

An introduction should contain the description of the topic in a brief and best way possible. An introduction should give us an idea about the topic. It should contain what, the whole lesson or essay , is about. All aspects should be condensed in the introduction, to enable the readers to have a fair idea of the lesson or topic.
